name: GoldMoney
tag_list: gold, silver, platinum, palladium, digital-gold-currency, virtual-currency, digital-currency, vaulting
overview:
Founded in 2001 GoldMoney provides the highest quality of custody services for over US$2B of customer assets held in gold, silver, platinum and palladium with vaults operated by London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) members in Hong Kong, London, Singapore, Toronto and Zurich.

GoldMoney is headquartered in Jersey and regulated by the Jersey Financial Services Commision (JFSC) as a Money Service Business. The JFSC is the main supervisory body that oversees and regulates Jersey’s financial services industry.

GoldMoney is a profitable, privately owned company without any debt, the books regularly audited by a Big Four accounting firm and its shareholders are focused on ensuring the long-term safety and security of customers’ assets. GoldMoney is backed by financially strong investors including publicly traded IAMGOLD, billionaire Eric Sprott the Founder and Chairman of Sprott Asset Management, Doug Casey the Chairman of Casey Research, David Tice the Founder of Prudent Bear Fund and several others.

The GoldMoney Standard ensures that (1) before being taken into GoldMoney custody every single precious metal bullion bar is ultrasound inspected to ensure it is free of foreign materials and defects and (2) the precious metals as represented in the GoldMoney system are audited quarterly by Inspectorate International Limited under ISAE 3402 procedures to conclude that they are actually present and accounted for. The vaults maintain insurance at least equal to one hundred percent (100%) of the value of Metal owned by Customers.

Under the Customer Agreement, customers may arrange at anytime to take physical delivery of their precious metals which will meet the LBMA Chain of Integrity Standard.

milestones.description: James and Geoff Turk introduce GoldMoney to the public
Customer orders lead to 1 metric tonne of gold in storage
The value of precious metals stored increases to US$100 million.
Surpass US$1 billion of customer assets in storage.
Surpasses US$2 billion of customer assets in storage
GoldMoney begins using ultrasound gold bar testing and introduces the GoldMoney Standard
